data.title: Various Artists
data.meta_description:
Soul Explosion by Various Artists, released 01 January 1969

1. Johnnie Taylor - Who's Making Love
2. Jimmy Hughes - I Like Everything About You
3. Booker T. & The M.G.'s - Hang 'Em High
4. Carla Thomas - Where Do I Go (From The Love Rock Musical "Hair")
5. Eddie Floyd - I've Never Found A Girl (To Love Me Like You Do)
6. Southwest F.O.B. - Smell Of Incense
7. Albert King - Cold Feet
8. Booker T. & The M.G.'s - Soul Limbo
9. The Mad Lads - So Nice
10. Eddie Floyd - Bring It On Home To Me
11. William Bell & Judy Clay - Private Number
12. The Staple Singers - Long Walk To D.C.
13. Ollie & The Nightingales - I've Got A Sure Thing
14. The Bar-Kays - Copy Kat
15. Booker T. & The M.G.'s - Soul Clap '69
16. The Staple Singers - Hear My Call
17. Johnnie Taylor - Save Your Love For Me
18. Jimmy Hughes - Peeped Around Yonder's Bend
19. Carla Thomas - Book Of Love
20. The Mad Lads - These Old Memories
21. Southwest F.O.B. - Mercy, Mercy, Mercy
22. The Bar-Kays - Hot Hips
23. Ollie & The Nightingales - Heartaches Mountain
24. Johnnie Taylor - Twenty Years From Today
25. Eddie Floyd - It's Wrong To Be Loving You
26. Judy Clay - It's Me
27. Booker T. & The M.G.'s - Booker's Theme
28. Albert King - Left Hand Woman (Get Right With Me)

Soul Explosion offers a sampling of the Stax Records' biggest hits and stars of the day, with Eddie Floyd, the Mad Lads, the Staple Singers, Albert King and more. The compilation also includes a selection of rare tracks, many of which are exclusive to this collection. These include the Bar-Kays’ “Hot Hips,” Ollie & The Nightingales’ “Heartache Mountain” and Eddie Floyd’s “It’s Wrong To Be Loving You.”
data.text: The STAX RECORDS story is an indispensable chapter in American musical history. Amid the civil rights-era racial strife and deep-seated tensions of the late '50s and '60s, Stax fundamentally shaped American soul music, spawning the careers of legends such as Otis Redding, Isaac Hayes, Booker T. & the MG's, The Staple Singers, Albert King and William Bell, just to name a few. ... more
